content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Easy to understand. And the possibility of having one output or two outputs make the challenge interesting. It's not too hard, a good test for quickness :)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: The game is fun and the goal is easy to understand. It's good for a CoC based on rapidity

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I accept this contribution because it's based on a real game and is  very fun and easy + I didn't see any problem in the game

hello
please add a player 2 winning scenario test 
it's unfair to see you got 100% in example but 60% at the end especially when you just forget a simple thing
you also can just swap validator 4 with test 2 IDK it depends on you

Goal
* Suggest to change the 3rd paragraph as:

Available cards are: {{2}}, {{3}}, {{4}}, {{5}}, {{6}}, {{7}}, {{8}}, {{9}}, {{10}}, {{Jack}}, {{Queen}}, {{King}}, {{Ace}}. The value of each number card is the same as its rank, while the value of {{Jack}}, {{Queen}}, {{King}}, {{Ace}} are {{11}}, {{12}}, {{13}} and {[14}} respectively.

(That's based on your solution code - it seems to be different from your statement.)

* In the list of quality of the win, 0 should not be described as "Good" as it is not really the expected output and thus confusing. Please delete that line.

Output
* Please separate the scenarios of non-war and war into two sections. The instruction to output nothing for Line 1 and "war" for Line 2 is incorrect, as "war" should be output in Line 1 in case of a war.

Thanks.

Hello! Thanks for your feedback.
Edited the submission

Hello!

Yes you're right, added Player2 winning scenarios 

Thx

Hello, and thank you for your changes.

Please fix the typo in Output section: "Otherwhise" => "Otherwise".
